title: Loop Through a Tuple
text: You can loop through the tuple items by using a for loop.

Example
Iterate through the items and print the values:

thistuple = ("apple", "banana", "cherry")
  for x in thistuple:  print(x)
Try it Yourself »
Learn more about for loops in our Python For Loops Chapter.

title: Loop Through the Index Numbers
text: You can also loop through the tuple items by referring to their index number.
Use the range() and len() functions to create a suitable iterable.

Example
Print all items by referring to their index number:

thistuple = ("apple", "banana", "cherry")
for i in range(len(thistuple)):
  print(thistuple[i])
Try it Yourself »

title: Using a While Loop
text: You can loop through the tuple items by using a while loop.

Use the len() function to determine the length of the tuple,
then start at 0 and loop your way through the tuple items by referring to their indexes.
Remember to increase the index by 1 after each iteration.

Example
Print all items, using a while loop to go through all the index numbers:

thistuple = ("apple", "banana", "cherry")
i = 0
while i < len(thistuple):
  print(thistuple[i])
  i = i + 1

Try it Yourself »

Python While Loops Chapter.
